docs.snippet: Probable Success of the Revolutionists--Retreat of Soulouque to Port-au-Palace. A private letter of Jan. 10, from Port-an-Prince, received via St. Thomas and Havana, says the Emperor SOULOUQUE had been defeated by Gen. GEFFRARD, and the Imperial...
docs.lead_paragraph: Probable Success of the Revolutionists--Retreat of Soulouque to Port-au-Palace. A private letter of Jan. 10, from Port-an-Prince, received via St. Thomas and Havana, says the Emperor SOULOUQUE had been defeated by Gen. GEFFRARD, and the Imperial troops were running back upon the city. SOUIOUQUE himself was expected every moment, and it was said that GEFFRARD was only a few leagues in his rear.

headline.main: LATER FROM UTAH.; Speedy Transmission of the President's Message by the Overland Mail. Procedings of the Courts--Murders, Robberies &c.--Spirit of te Mormous--The Governor's Message.

docs.lead_paragraph: We were most agreeably disappointed on last Saturday evfning-Chrfstmas Day- by the arrival of the express with the President's Message, through in eleven days from St. Joseph's Mission to this city. In consequence of the severe and almost incessant storms which have prevailed for the past five weeks, we had abandoned all hopes of receiving the Message by exPress,and least of all In so short time.

headline.main: WASHINGTON SOCIETY.; Sketches and Glimpses of Men and Women at the Capital--An Evening at the White House and a Senatorial Ball.

docs.snippet: It required the foolishness of homeopathy to teach regular orthodox doctors the folly of so much trusting to pills: and "Glaucus" fears lest it may be necessary to organize a party of do-nothing reformers to teach this Legislature that not everything...

headline.main: AFFAIRS AT ALBANY.; A Flood of Bills--Interesting Proposals Touching Certain City Officials--A Tremendous Omnibus--Ferries for the Million, &c., &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: It required the foolishness of homeopathy to teach regular orthodox doctors the folly of so much trusting to pills: and "Glaucus" fears lest it may be necessary to organize a party of do-nothing reformers to teach this Legislature that not everything in this world and age is to be done by bills. The mania for introducing bills is all-pervading.

headline.main: NEWS FROM CALIFORNIA.; $1,21013 IN TREASURE. San Francisco Dates to the 5th of January. ARRIVAL OF THE ILLINOIS.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail steaming Illinois, JOHN McGOWAN, Commander, from Aspinwall on the 19th inst., arrived at this port at 11 A.M., yesterday, with the mails and treasure brought to Panama by the Golden Age, which steamship left San Francisco on the 5th inst. Most of the California news by this arrival has been anticipated by the overland mall, our latest dates through that channel
